intro: Dendrocnide warburgii, commonly known as the Warburg's stinging nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its finely hairy, often stinging leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves contain irritant chemicals that can cause skin irritation upon contact. Dendrocnide warburgii is often found in rainforests and along stream banks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
